Don't do that. If you think a thread needs moderator attention just hit the report button, it is not appropriate to call it out publicly like this. Refer to Rule 3.2. The thread isn't breaking any forum rules (so far at least), and we're not generally in the business of preemptive locking so it will stay open for now.

As for the OP's question: Play how you like and don't worry if other people think it's cheating. The only cheating in KSP is if you cheat yourself out of enjoyment of the game, if you like playing with other people's craft then by all means go ahead and have fun with it.

To answer what I think is the underlying concern behind most of these threads:

No, the average community/forum member doesn't consider using a ship downloaded by other people to be "cheating" or "cheesy" or "beardy" or however it is you say it where ever it is you're from. It is quite common and not typically frowned upon in any way.

That said there is no accounting for taste as they say, so...someone at some point will probably judge you or look down their nose at you for not building it yourself. Not that they would be right for doing so, but that won't stop them.

Here's my two cents, if anyone cares.

Individual player computer games can be adapted to make it more interesting for the player through mods, expansion packs, or even cheats. As long as no one is getting hurt, you're not doing anything illegal, and you don't blog about how you made it to whatever objectives unassisted - then who cares? If you enjoy testing the craft of others, then download away! Have fun! If you need MechJeb to auto-dock, you're doing what NASA does, so who cares? Have fun! If you need the "approval" of others when you play a game (or do anything in life, really), then you are letting others decide what your "fun" is, whatever that may be.

Does NASA cheat when they use a Russian made engine? No.

Did Russian cheat when the made the Buran shuttle? No.

We are a community helping one another.
